title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message:

Thanks Dear

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message: If this is not liquid then it could be absolutely anything. Was it dropped maybe? Could be bad RAM too, sorry to say that these cases are usually pretty hopeless.

message:

i am trying all this, with two USB drives, one with the installable files, And the other the destination !!

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message:

What do u think !!

thanks Pal

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message:
Messing with the RAM like that is a last resort. You can try it but I suspect the machine has had an impact and traces will be damaged.

Make sure the clock is set correctly too before installing or it won't work. Use the "date" command in terminal before continuing with the install.

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message:
Hi Duke!!

I have some updates:

C2606, was kindda of brown ( like roasted... ) on leg 1 ( pp1v2_s3) i measure diode mode and it gives 0,082, And on a working board 0,126!! I repealed it but same measurements !! Nevertheless is measures fine 1,2 volts!! I am confused

P.D: Have 2 working board , the measure is the same 0,126!!

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message:
Maybe we have a suspect? U7400 ? That is lowering ?

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message: I really have no idea. Random kernel panic issues like this can be absolutely anything and are a huge waste of time for a "one off" problem. I recommend not wasting time with this board if you cannot find any liquid or if there is no history as to how this may have happened.

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message:
Hi Duke!! It’s very very well payed this one , for that reason!!

0,080 and 0.120 it’s like 50% difference on that line!! A cap on that line , u7400, or a memory chip can be ? Can I desolder one after one ? And check of it normaliza measurement on the line , right ?

title: 820-4924 Ssd issues - Reboot White Apple Logo
message:
You could, but I think it is a waste of time as 0.12 or 0.08 is not cause for worry. It depends on the type of RAM chips used and the CPU. Only if they are 100% the same can you compare diode mode measurements like that. 
If it is VERY well payed just get another board to fix it.
